00037 mcs::Synchro::Synchro()
00038 {
00039   MCS_DEBUG_SETUP(0, "Synchro");
00040   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER(NOARGS);
00041 
00042   Count = 0;
00043   isActive = false;
00044 
00045   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(NOARGS);
00046 }
00047 
00048 
00049 mcs::Synchro::~Synchro()
00050 {
00051   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER(NOARGS);
00052 
00053   synchronize(false);
00054 
00055   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(NOARGS);
00056 }

00058 int mcs::Synchro::count()
00059 { return Count; }

00061 
00062 void mcs::Synchro::synchronize(bool setactive)
00063 {
00064   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER( << isActive);
00065 
00066   if (Count != 0)
00067     throw MCS_FATAL( MSG_CANT_SET_SYNCHRO_STATE );
00068 
00069   if ((! isActive)   &&   (setactive)) {
00070 //LN-darwin
00071 /* 
00072    One of PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_NP and PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE seem to be 
00073    present in different versions.  For example, Mac OS X 10.4 had 
00074    PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_NP but Mac OS X 10.5 does not; instead it has
00075     PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE 
00076  */
00077 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_NP
00078 #define PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_VALUE PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_NP
00079 //#elif def HAVE_PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE
00080 //#define PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_VALUE PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE
00081 #else
00082 #define PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_VALUE PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE
00083 //#error 'Unable to determine pthread mutex recursive value'
00084 #endif /* pthread mutex recursive value */
00085 
00086     pthread_mutexattr_settype(&attr, PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE_VALUE);
00087 #ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_MUTEXATTR_SETPROTOCOL
00088     pthread_mutexattr_setprotocol(&attr, PTHREAD_PRIO_NONE);
00089 #endif
00090 //LN-darwin: apparently any attribute seting causes failure! 
00091     //pthread_mutex_init(&mutex, &attr);
00092     pthread_mutex_init(&mutex, NULL);
00093   }
00094 
00095   if ((isActive)   &&   (! setactive)) {
00096     int ret = pthread_mutex_destroy(&mutex);
00097     assert(ret == 0);
00098   }
00099 
00100   isActive = setactive;
00101   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE( << isActive );
00102 }
00103 
00104 
00105 bool mcs::Synchro::enter(int op, unsigned int to)
00106 {
00107   int ret = 0;
00108 
00109   if (! isActive) return true;
00110   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER(NOARGS);
00111 
00112   switch (op) {
00113   case MCS_SYNCHRO_LOCK:
00114     ret = pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00115     break;
00116   case MCS_SYNCHRO_TRY_LOCK:
00117     ret = pthread_mutex_trylock(&mutex);
00118     break;
00119   case MCS_SYNCHRO_TRY_TIMED:
00120     struct timeval now;
00121     struct timespec timeout;
00122     unsigned int millisec, seconds;
00123     millisec = to % 1000;
00124     seconds  = (unsigned int) floor((double) (to / 1000.0));
00125     gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
00126     timeout.tv_sec = now.tv_sec + seconds;
00127     timeout.tv_nsec = now.tv_usec * 1000 + millisec * 1000000;
00128 
00129 //LN-darwin
00130 #if defined(_POSIX_TIMEOUTS) && (_POSIX_TIMEOUTS - 200112L) >= 0L
00131     ret = pthread_mutex_timedlock(&mutex, &timeout);
00132 #else
00133     ret = pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00134 #endif
00135     break;
00136   }
00137 
00138 //cout<<"pthread_mutex_lock ret="<<ret<<
00139 //      "  EDEADLK:"<<EDEADLK<<" EAGAIN:"<<EAGAIN<<" EINVAL:"<<EINVAL<<endl;
00140   assert((ret == 0)          ||
00141      (ret == EBUSY)      ||
00142      (ret == ETIMEDOUT)    );
00143 
00144 
00145   if (ret == 0) {
00146     Count++;
00147   }
00148 
00149 
00150   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(NOARGS);
00151   return (ret == 0);
00152 }
00153 
00154 
00155 
00156 int mcs::Synchro::leave()
00157 {
00158   if (! isActive) return 0;
00159   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER(<< Count);
00160 
00161   int ret;
00162   ret = pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
00163 
00164   assert(ret == 0);
00165 
00166   if (ret == 0)
00167     Count--;
00168 
00169   return Count;
00170   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(NOARGS);
00171 }
00172 
00173 
00174 bool mcs::Synchro::tryenter(unsigned int timeout)
00175 {
00176   if (timeout == 0)
00177     return enter(MCS_SYNCHRO_TRY_LOCK);
00178   else
00179     return enter(MCS_SYNCHRO_TRY_TIMED, timeout);
00180 }

00220 mcs::Thread::Thread(int id, Thread* parent) : syn_lstate()
00221 {
00222   MCS_DEBUG_SETUP(0, "Thread");
00223 
00224   lparent = parent;
00225   lid = id;
00226   lerror = NULL;
00227 
00228   lstate = MCS_STATE_CREATED;
00229   syn_lstate.synchronize(true);
00230 
00231   detached = false;
00232   selfDelete = false;
00233 
00234   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(<< lid);
00235 }
00236 
00237 
00238 mcs::Thread::~Thread()
00239 {
00240   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER(<< lid);
00241   if (pthread_self() != lthrID)
00242     stop();
00243 
00244   if (lerror)
00245     delete lerror;
00246   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(<< lid);
00247 }

00268 void mcs::Thread::cleanup_Handler(void* p)
00269 { ((Thread*) p)->final(); }

00273 { throw MCS_ERROR(MSG_METHOD_MUST_BE_OVERLOADED, "Thread::run"); }

00275 void mcs::Thread::notify(int id, Thread* ref)
00276 {
00277 #if ENABLE_DEBUG
00278     char buf[10];
00279     sprintf(buf, "%d", id);
00280     string s = "Notify from " + string(buf);
00281     MCS_DEBUG(lid << " " << s.c_str());
00282 #endif
00283 }

00287 void mcs::Thread::set_cancel_state(bool cancel)
00288 {
00289   int ret;
00290   if (cancel) {
00291     ret = pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_ENABLE, NULL);
00292     assert(ret == 0);
00293     ret = pthread_setcanceltype(PTHREAD_CANCEL_DEFERRED, NULL);
00294     assert(ret == 0);
00295   }
00296   else {
00297     ret = pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_DISABLE, NULL);
00298     assert(ret == 0);
00299   }
00300 }
00301 
00302 
00303 void mcs::Thread::test_cancel()
00304 {
00305   int old, ret;
00306   ret = pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_ENABLE, &old);
00307   assert(ret == 0);
00308   ret = pthread_setcanceltype(PTHREAD_CANCEL_DEFERRED, NULL);
00309   assert(ret == 0);
00310 
00311   pthread_testcancel();
00312 
00313   ret = pthread_setcancelstate(old, NULL);
00314   assert(ret == 0);
00315 }

00319 void mcs::Thread::startDetached(bool selfdelete)
00320 {
00321   detached = true;
00322   selfDelete = selfdelete;
00323   start();
00324 }
00325 
00326 
00327 void mcs::Thread::start()
00328 {
00329   int ret;
00330   MCS_DEBUG_ENTER(<< lid);
00331 
00332   ret = pthread_create(&lthrID, NULL, Thread::RunThread, this);
00333   if (ret)
00334       throw MCS_FATAL(MSG_CALLING_PTHREAD_CREATE);
00335 
00336   if (detached) {
00337     ret = pthread_detach(lthrID);
00338     if (ret != 0)
00339       throw MCS_FATAL(MSG_CALLING_PTHREAD_CREATE);
00340   }
00341 
00342   //Continue only after initial() have been executed
00343   while (lstate < MCS_STATE_RUNNING)
00344     sleep_ms(1);
00345 
00346   MCS_DEBUG_LEAVE(<< lid);
00347 }
00348 
00349 
00350 
00351 void* mcs::Thread::RunThread(void* args)
00352 {
00353   Thread* thr = (Thread*) args;
00354 
00355   //Install the cleanup handler
00356   pthread_cleanup_push(cleanup_Handler, thr);
00357 
00358   thr->set_cancel_state(true);
00359 
00360   try {
00361     thr->initial();
00362     thr->lstate = MCS_STATE_RUNNING;
00363 
00364     //From the run() method it is possible to
00365     // - return
00366     // - throw an exception
00367     // - another thread call the stop() method
00368     thr->run();
00369   }
00370   catch (Event e) {
00371     thr->lerror = new Event(e);
00372     //cerr << e.msg() << endl;
00373   }
00374 
00375   thr->set_cancel_state(false);
00376 
00377   if (thr->checkTerminating()) {
00378     pthread_exit(NULL);
00379     return NULL;
00380   }
00381 
00382   pthread_cleanup_pop(0);
00383   thr->final();
00384 
00385   thr->lstate = MCS_STATE_END;
00386 
00387   //The thread is terminating by itself and will eventually notify its
00388   //parent who won't call the stop() method. In this case the
00389   //pthread_cancel and pthread_join functions won't be called and the
00390   //resources won't be freed. Calling pthread_detach() here will
00391   //detach the thread and resources will be freed at the
00392   //pthread_exit() call.
00393   pthread_detach(thr->lthrID);
00394 
00395   if (thr->lparent)
00396     thr->lparent->notify(thr->lid, thr);
00397 
00398   if (thr->selfDelete)
00399     delete thr;
00400 
00401 
00402   pthread_exit(NULL);
00403   return NULL;
00404 }
00405 
00406 
00407 
00408 void mcs::Thread::stop()
00409 {
00410   //This method MUST not be called from the thread itself
00411   assert(pthread_self() != lthrID);
00412 
00413   if (detached)
00414     return; //ERROR: Can't stop a detached thread
00415 
00416   bool wasterminating = checkTerminating();
00417   //If the thread was already terminating the rest of the job has been
00418   //performed in the RunThread() method, so we can return.
00419   if (wasterminating)
00420     return;
00421 
00422   //If the thread is not detached then the parent thread MUST call
00423   //pthread_cancel() and pthread_join() to free resources.
00424 
00425   pthread_cancel(lthrID); //final() will be called here if the cleanup
00426               //handler is still installed
00427   pthread_join(lthrID, NULL);
00428 
00429   //Il controllo wasterminating ==> return era qui.
00430 
00431   lstate = MCS_STATE_END;
00432 
00433   if (lparent)
00434     lparent->notify(lid, this);
00435 }
00436 
00437 
00438 bool mcs::Thread::checkTerminating()
00439 {
00440   bool ret;
00441 
00442   syn_lstate.enter();
00443   ret = (lstate >= MCS_STATE_TERMINATING);
00444   if (!ret)
00445     lstate = MCS_STATE_TERMINATING;
00446   syn_lstate.leave();
00447 
00448   return ret;
00449 }

00455 mcs::ThreadFunc::ThreadFunc(int (*start_routine)(void*),
00456                 void* arg) :
00457   Thread(0, NULL)
00458 {
00459   this->start_routine1 = start_routine;
00460   this->start_routine2 = NULL;
00461   this->arg = arg;
00462   ret = 0;
00463 }
00464 
00465 mcs::ThreadFunc::ThreadFunc(Event* (*start_routine)(void*),
00466                 void* arg) :
00467   Thread(0, NULL)
00468 {
00469   this->start_routine1 = NULL;
00470   this->start_routine2 = start_routine;
00471   this->arg = arg;
00472   ret = 0;
00473 }
00474 
00475 
00476 void mcs::ThreadFunc::run()
00477 {
00478   if (start_routine1)
00479     ret = (start_routine1)(arg);
00480   else
00481     lerror = (start_routine2)(arg);
00482 }
00483 
00484 int mcs::ThreadFunc::retcode()
00485 { return ret; }

00492 
00493 void mcs::sleep_ms(unsigned int millisec)
00494 {
00495   struct timespec tt, tmp;
00496   tt.tv_sec = 0;
00497   tt.tv_nsec = 0;
00498 
00499 
00500   if (millisec >= 1000) {
00501     tt.tv_sec = ((long int) (millisec / 1000.0));
00502   }
00503 
00504   tt.tv_nsec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000000;
00505   nanosleep(&tt, &tmp);
00506 }
